title: How do I get rid of Ekko early game, I can't deny farm!
body:
Whenever I have an Ekko on the enemy team, I always buy boots first regardless of whether or not he's going mid lane. This is because his slow and CC is ridiculous at early levels.

The main strategy against Ekko is to deny CS by pushing a lot, but even when I buy as much AP as I can and get AP runes and masteries (I used to buy the most AP in one item at the start of a match) I can't poke him enough to recall and let me farm, as he easily clears the minion wave at level 3. And this is considering he _doesn't_ buy a crystalline flask or five health potions. When I **do** get him to low HP, I run out of mana and need to recall too, or AA until I get ganked by the enemy jungle.

And his range, he can dash then combine it with one of his other skills to outrange me while doing more damage. And this is when I play {{champion:101}} and passively farm with Q.

replies.body:
Xerath is a major counter to Ekko

Along with Azir, Malzahar a level 2 Yasuo.

Skill matchups include Ahri, Akali or Twisted Fate.

You counter him by not standing in the minion wave - then he has to choose to use his Q to clear waves or harass. The range is only 750 at fast speed, the remaining 300 is super slow.

However, if he DOES tag you with Q (even once), side-step immediately or else you'll be in his slow field for him to apply his passive and hit you with the return, or land an easy W with a crippled slow.

Basically, you counter him by outplaying Timewinder and poking him while it's down. If he initates with E, CC him and kite back. Poke him to hell; his dash is maxed second and does have a decent CD early ranks.

Parallel Convergence's range is 1600, according to the wiki, while arcanopulse is 1400 maximum. Considering the huge diameter being longer than 1100, as he can easily dash and hit me at arcanopulse range while standing in the area (so he can stun me rather than slow), and his dash is 325 units long, he actually outranges me to the point I can't even kite with Q. His timewinder nearly matches up with my eye of destruction, only being 25 units short (and longer than my E, which is my CC, and his longer ranged AOE stun always stuns for longer, even if I stun from the maximum distance), and when combined with a dash, the slow or stun allows him to walk up to me (using his boots that he bought with his ton of CS) and use his full combo.

wtf Riot, your "Assassin Fighter" Role who's meant to be melee, has enough range to match up marksmen, while having enough CC to be a secondary support, the waveclear to be a mage, and is bursty and mobile enough to be an assassin.

All I do now is farm from behind the tower, because there really isn't any fighting with this guy, he just kills a majority of mid laners (who are _mostly_ burst AP, the counters you listed are more top lane) without using his cheat time travel device.

Yes, I do poke him with every single ability I can. Even when I hit all skillshots using angles that hit all of the minion wave too, I can't kill him pre-6, and even then, I only consistently get tied kills with Ekko if he doesn't have a smart player buying boots to dodge my ult.

Ekko beats AP because he's an assassin, and I'm asking how an AP mid beats him because his power spike is at extremely early levels. I have yet to see Ekko beat a tank up _easily_.

Stop trying to say Xerath outranges Ekko, he doesn't. The numbers and my experience make it clear, and yes, you can't sway me to your opinion simply because _your opinion simply doesn't match up with what I've observed so far._ Now _please_ quit the whole "I won't argue because I'm right" bullcrap and give me a straight answer on how to fight Ekko, like that guy who recommended I get Merc Treads (I usually get swiftness boots, actually).

If you played an assassin or bruiser or whatever, you could try lane bullying, by that I mean zoning him from his creeps by standing behind the wave, you could also proxy farm, by killing the wave before it gets to him, for example behind his turret.
Play {{champion:31}}  into him. You destroy him easily at all stages of the game.
not a fan of cho mid that much but yes him and any other sustain champ can get the edge, i think vlad would be a more favourable matchup, or just the jungler camping mid for you

I actually think that Cho'Gath is his absolute counter-pick. He is tanky enough to take more than one combo to kill, has reliable hard CC to disrupt his combo, and can sustain any poke he takes. Vlad also counters him fairly well, but he has no CC to disrupt Ekko so Ekko can still land his combo while Vlad's Pool is on CD.

You want to play something tanky that can take his full combo, or something that can out-sustain it. Vlad is a good option for this, as well as Cho'Gath. Teemo, if you play him well, also can counter Ekko because of his blind, and you can bait him into your shrooms. His MS boost can help you live to, but he is squishy enough to get 3-shot by Ekko if he does catch you.

You have to look at it this way, Ekko will poke you every chance he gets. If he is farming over poking you, while you are poking him, then you are winning. This is why Ekko basically grabs a free kill at lvl2, because he pokes you with Q, then when you get to around half health, he just E's in to pop his passive and if you are still alive, ignites your ass for the kill.

Oh, and try to grab Merc Treads if you can put them in your build, since the MR and Tenacity is quite useful against Ekko.

There are few champions that can clear a wave easily at level 3. Ekko is not one of them. He has to use 2 rotations of Q to even remotely clear the wave quickly. His slow at early levels mainly comes from his passive, so dodge the backswing of Q to prevent E dash follow up slow/damage.

Xerath does not really run out of mana. Use. your. passive. Also, use auto attacks; they are the main method of damage in many early game skirmishes.

This is the most optimal situation I find myself in when playing against an Ekko who isn't feeding on purpose, or dumb:
- Ekko uses two rotations of Q, trying to hit me while getting most of the wave to low or mid HP
- I back off for a few seconds to avoid getting hit, then come back immediately
- Ekko has gotten most of the caster minions with his auto attack, and retreats to have a better chance at dodging my skills and for the melee minions
- I try to clear the minion wave while hitting all of my skillshots at Ekko with my positioning. (Remember, this is the most optimal situation, chances are, he's gotten boots or simply has a seizure when I raise my arms up.)
- I run out of mana, and proc passive, either on Ekko himself, or on another minion, it doesn't matter. Even if I do get 1-4 auto attacks on him while I know his abilities are on cooldown, he just retreats earlier to compensate.
- I Q to get him to critical health
- Crystalline flask or health potion, and playing passive until he gets to half health. By the time his potions are used up, my passive is finally off cooldown and I can stop auto attacking and poke him again.
- Recall after running out of potions, but usually I die before this happens, and the jungler is confirmed to approach at this point.

The process repeats until Ekko begs for the jungler to gank me, while I beg the jungler to gank Ekko. If Ekko gets his jungler out, he wins instantly, if I get my jungler out first, he has a moderate chance of finally dying. Even if I **do** avoid dying for all of the laning phase, if Ekko doesn't die more than once, he ends up snowballing somehow even if I have more CS than he does.

Arguably even worse matchup than LeBlanc. When she dodges, it's because she's dashed or teleported. When Ekko dodges, it's because he's gotten two slows on me, or a slow and a stun.

Yasuo is his sempai.

School's Ekko any day of the week
